greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Write 1,2,... in a clockwise spiral on a square lattice, writing each digit at a separate lattice point, starting with 1 at the origin and 2 at x=0, y=-1; sequence gives the numbers on the positive x-axis.
comment: Same as the South spoke of the Champernowne spiral (A244677).
link: Andrey Zabolotskiy, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: almostNatural[n_, b_] := Block[{m = 0, d = n, i = 1, l, p}, While[m <= d, l = m; m = (b - 1) i*b^(i - 1) + l; i++]; i--; p = Mod[d - l, i]; q = Floor[(d - l)/i] + b^(i - 1); If[p != 0, IntegerDigits[q, b][[p]], Mod[q - 1, b]]];
f[n_] := 4n^2 - 5n + 2; Array[ almostNatural[ f@#, 10] &, 105] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 08 2014 *)
results.author: Olivier Gorin (gorin(AT)roazhon.inra.fr)
